content:
I have this problem also and would love to downgrade back as it really is a thing I use daily.

I have tried to comment on the bug but it always says I do not have permission to comment on a closed bug.

I use it mainly for marking multiple folders read at the same time. I get in alerts from various systems and often it is not a matter of what the alert says, but how many of them their are (but I can't just use a counter as just as often I need the content of these emails). My filters direct these emails into certain folders and they sit there and my little number that shows the number of new emails on those folder increases. At certain levels I need to do something and mark a number of these folders as unread. It has always been super easy as I hold down Ctrl and just start selecting a dozen or so folders and once I have the ones I need to clear I right click and select mark read and I am all set. I can no longer do that and it is really effecting a pretty important process that has worked fine with thunderbird for 15+ years.

I cannot fathom why this bug was marked won't fix.

It's always been super easy as I hold down Ctrl and just start selecting the number of folders I wanted. It takes a very long time to backup this way as it is now. content:
A few suggestions:

click the icon next to the Quick Filter button and select Table View to show more headers in the message list so the list height can be reduced (drag the separator between the list and Message Pane)

try View/Layout/Vertical View for a larger Message Pane

install Compact Headers to reduce the Header Pane, even to a single line

content: That isn't an issue controlled by Thunderbird. Instead, you should check with your email provider. The issue is complex, as the receiving email provider may also ban you. From my own experience, you will do better with a mass mailer, such as Mailchimp, and even there you have the possibility, though less, of being banned. I've been there and it's like fighting a ghost sometimes.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thunderbird has no limits because it's just a program on your computer. But as a general guide I recall people used to find there was a limit of approximately 60 addresses when sending messages if you enter each address separately, but it may be to do with limits imposed by server. However, if you use lists (mail distribution lists) for most of the addresses any limit is imposed by whatever SMTP server you use.

Each mail account will connect to a specific server. That mail account may be provided by your ISP or a free one provided by eg: gmail or maybe you have purchased an email address. All servers have their limits on what you can send and the limit varies between servers. Some limit number of emails per hour and/or per 24 hour rolling period. Most do not permit large scale bulk emails and some offer that ability but you have to pay for it.

For example - Gmail limits - note there is a difference between limits sending via smtp 3rd party software and sending directly using webmail account. https://support.google.com/a/answer/166852 https://support.google.com/mail/answer/22839
creator: Toad-Hall

content: On Unified Toolbar, right click and select 'Customise' You can put the 'Quick Filter' button onto the 'Unified Toolbar'. This means you can hide the 'Message List Header' if not desired and still have access to enable/disable the 'Quick Filter' You can drag the 'Global Search' off the toolbar and drop it under the 'Available for all spaces' section. You cannot put the actual 'Quick Filter' toolbar onto the 'Unified Toolbar' because it is not just a search option which opens results in a different tab. It has its own filter options within it's own toolbar and they only apply the filters to the selected folder, so the view remains in the Mail tab.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Maybe you have your Anti-Virus set up to scan everything you are sending? Suggest you switch it off.

Also check to see if the Anti-Virus is also adding it's own signature to all your outgoing mail. You can switch that off as well.

For example AVG: https://support.avg.com/SupportArticleView?l=en&urlname=avg-antivirus-email-signature
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You have 'Sort by' > 'Threaded' enabled.

If you have a collapsed thread and you click on the top level thread then this means open all threads in that conversation thread and it's not new. This action has been in Thunderbird for a very long time.

You have two options: 1. Expand the thread by clicking on the chevron icon shown to the left of the Email so you see all subthreads then click on the relevant email. 2. Switch off threading - View > Sort by > select 'Unthreaded'
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Nelle precedenti versioni del programma Thunderbird, quando si cercava un messaggio inviato da una determinata corrispondenza, nel riquadro della posta in arrivo venivano visualizzati/raggruppati tutti i messaggi relativi ad uno specifico indirizzo di posta elettronica, in modo tale da facilitare l'eliminazione o lo spostamento, dopo averli selezionati. Questa funzione manca in Thunderbird Supernova, funzione che, tra l'altro, era molto comoda, perchè consentiva, in un unico passaggio, di visualizzare/raggruppare tutti i messaggi di un particolare mittente e cancellarli o spostarli. Nel menù "Strumenti" manca l'opzione "Cerca messaggi". Dato che il sito support.mozilla.org non è un servizio di supporto tecnico, a chi mi devo rivolgere? Quindi, il termine "support" viene usato impropriamente! Sto dando il mio contributo, facendoLe rilevare una omissione, che direi è molto importante, in un programma che di per sé è abbastanza completo. Spero, questa volta, di essere stato chiaro. La ringrazio, ancora una volta, per il Suo interessamento.
creator: f.gvalenti

content: A chi ti devi rivolgere? Non so... se hai pagato qualcuno per un servizio di assistenza tecnica rivolgiti a lui. Altrimenti questo ed altri siti di volontari sono tutto ciò che è disponibile. Spero di essere stato chiaro anch'io.

content:
First Check your Thunderbird is not being blocked by your Firewall. If it is blocked by Firewall then nothing will work so get that set up first.

Exit Thunderbird Access Firewall which may be controlled by your Anti-virus product Set up Thunderbird as an allowed program.


Next check the password: There is only one password which can work for a specific account and it is the one you use to logon to the webmail account via a browser. Logon to webmail account via a browser then you know the correct password for that account. If you cannot get password to work then there is usually a 'forgotten password' link which you can use to regainaccess to webmail account and then you set up the password.

It would help if you posted the server settings you are using. In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Copy everything and paste it into this forum question.

Then we can check everything is correct.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Here are the known steps to recover Thunderbird when primary password is not known: select tools>developer tools>error console then enter 

  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")    and press reset button.

This process removes all passwords so they will need to be reentered.

content: You're trying to do it from the Identities window, which isn't possible if there is a single identity. To remove an account, select it in the left pane of Account Settings, Account Actions at the bottom of the pane, Remove Account. The Default account can't be removed, so set another account as Default in Account Actions, and then the other one can be removed.

content: I've found that this problem goes away (temporarily) by adding a new mail account. Immediately after adding the new mail account, all my toolbars miraculously appear. This includes the top customizable toolbar, the spaces toolbar and my QuickFolders toolbar. Unfortunately, after restarting Thunderbird they are all gone again. I have found that I can simply go to Account Settings > Account Actions > Add Mail Account... then cancel... and the toolbars appear... until I restart again.
